title: 21: Virtue
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at http://philosophytalk.org/shows/virtue.

What is virtue? Is virtue the key human happiness and flourishing, as the ancients held, or a quaint notion of at best secondary interest for ethics, as many modern theorists hold?  Does the return of virtue ethics to the philosophical scene mark an advance in our thinking about morality or is it just a nostalgia for morally simpler times? Jon and Ken sing the praises of Julia Driver from Dartmouth College, author of "Uneasy Virtue."
